result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan Ann Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Morgan Ann Moreno is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Morgan Ann Moreno was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Court notes 86 days credit against ultimate sentence.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-MRT, Court orders Defendant to begin while completing condition time.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with New Richmond Wal-Mart of David Ask.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Defendant to pursue education or employment.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Rohan. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud   DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Includes: 15CF539, 16CF16. Cases called at 10:46 am. Court reviews file. DEF requests to waive drug court termination hearing and voluntarily terminate. Court explains right to hearing and consequences of waiver. Court finds DEF freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to drug court termination hearing. Court grants motion to terminate DEF from Drug Court. Adjourned 10:49 am
Hearing on January 5, 2018 at 10:30 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF539 and 16CF16:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud   DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Case called at 2:52 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for a status to see if counsel has been appointed. Court is in the understanding that the termination is still heading forward. Atty Skatrud requesting a hearing. Court will schedule a hearing. Advises parties may need to reset if Drug Court team is unavailable at that date and time.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2018 at 10:30 am.
filed by Liesl Nelson; hereby appointing atty Arne Skatrud. jl

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF539 and 16CF16:

DA Nieskes states DE called PD's office and no one has been appointed as of now. Court will continue matter until next week. Court will have judicial assistant follow up with the public defender's office.  Hearing scheduled for December 28, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF539 and 16CF16:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF:  Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail, pro se. Case called at 11:56 a.m. Court notes this hearing is to hear a waiver of termination of drug court. DE does not want an attorney and does not want to be terminated from drug court. Court reviews rights with DE to obtain counsel. Court directs DE to contact the public defender's office for counsel and will not accept waiver today. Court will continue matter until 12-22-17 at 1:00 p.m.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF ATTY: Greg Amann DF: Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Case called at 10:30. Stormont makes sentencing recommendations, DE has completed AODA in the jail. Atty. Amann makes sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Court rec'd letters from grandparents of DE. 

On 15CF539
Sentence I/S 7 years Total, 3 years initial. 4 years ES
86 days credit against ultimate sentence 
5 years probation with conditions:
- 6 months St. Croix County Jail
  Huber is authorized for work or seek work.
- AODA and any recommended follow through and treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing. 
- MRT, Court orders to begin while completing condition time. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, New Richmond Wal Mart, David. Ask.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.
- Costs of $268
- DE to pursue education or employment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann and Atty. A. Stormont DF: Morgan Ann Moreno appeared from jail. Case called at 1:34. Includes 15CF206, 15CF539, 16CF79, 16CF16, 15CM667, 15CF79, 15CF164. ADA Minser updates the court. Atty. Stormont agrees. Atty. Amann agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended misd. theft Ct 1 in 15CF206 and to amended Ct 3 in 15CF539 amending it to 3-10 grams. DE pleads G to 16CF16 and 15CM667. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of  amended Ct 1 in 15CF206 and amended Ct 3 in 15CF206 amending it to 3-10 grams a class E felony and G of 16CF16 and 15CM667.On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF206, Ct 4,5,6 in 15CF539, 16CF79, 15CF79 and 15CF164. Sentencing arguments. Court orders a PSI to be completed within 60 days. DE is remanded and bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing at 03-04-2016 01:00 pm

INCLUDES 15CF539 and 15CM667

Report every  Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

and  _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  David A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
